1: The branches of the explanandum establish the preliminary framework of authorship, teaching quality, and proper conduct before the main instructions of the Lamp of the Path are presented.
1.1: Recognizing the greatness of Atisha as the author of the text inspires confidence and devotion as a preliminary to receiving the main instructions.
1.2: Appreciating the greatness of the teaching itself establishes the value and authority of the Lamp of the Path before its instructions are given.
1.3: Guidance on how a teaching endowed with the greatness of both its author and its content should be properly heard and explained sets the tone for receiving the Lamp of the Path.
2: The meaning of the main instructions constitutes the heart of the Lamp of the Path, presenting the complete graduated training from lesser through superior persons.
2.1: The title of the text announces the scope and purpose of the main instructions of the Lamp of the Path to Enlightenment.
2.2: The translator's homage honours the lineage of transmission through which the main instructions of the Lamp of the Path have been conveyed.
2.3: The text itself contains the full body of Atisha's main instructions, from the opening homage through the complete exegesis of the graduated path.
2.3.1: Atisha's homage and commitment to compose the work opens the text itself with reverence and resolve to set forth the main instructions.

2.3.2.2.2: The characteristics of the intermediate person's path describe the cultivation of renunciation and liberation within the graduated framework of the three types of practitioner.
2.3.2.2.3: The characteristics of the superior person's path present the bodhisattva's training in compassion, bodhicitta, and the union of method and wisdom as the highest of the three graduated levels of practice.
